dialogue.text: Yo bestie, Java OOP is absolutely sending me! There are four sigma principles that are straight fire: Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, and Abstraction!
Bruh, that sounds like Ohio nonsense! What's all this encap-whatever? Are you just making up words to sound smart or what?
Nah fam, Encapsulation is like keeping your variables on private mode! You hide the data and only let methods access it. It's giving main character energy for data protection!
That's actually lowkey genius! So it's like having a security system for your code? What about this inheritance thing that sounds sus?
Inheritance is when child classes yeet all the properties from parent classes! It's like getting all your parent's rizz without the work. Pure alpha move for code reuse!
This is absolutely bussin! So classes can inherit powers like some anime protagonist? And what's polymorphism - sounds like it's trying too hard to be different!
Polymorphism means one method can have different behaviors depending on the object! Same name, different vibes. It's giving shape-shifter energy, totally not NPC behavior!
My brain is literally exploding! And abstraction? Let me guess, it's about hiding complex stuff and keeping things simple for the users?
EXACTLY! Abstraction is like showing only the sigma features while hiding all the cringe implementation details. It's the GOAT principle for clean code architecture!
Java OOP is actually fire! These four principles are like the ultimate cheat codes for building scalable applications. I'm definitely not sleeping on Java anymore!
